title: Babylon Viewer: simplifying viewing 3D models in web and native apps

content.title: BABYLON VIEWER
content.desc: While the Babylon platform can power any number of graphics scenarios, rendering a 3D model is a very common one. The Babylon Viewer is created specifically for this scenario and provides a simple, robust solution for rendering a 3D model in a web page or native app.
The 3D model rendered at the top of this page can be rendered on your own page with the simple code snippet below!

img.alt: Illustration of laptop computer, desktop computer, smart phone, and tablet.

content.title: Simple
content.desc: The Babylon Viewer make it easy to load, view, and interact with a 3D model on the Web. With only a few lines of code, gltf/glb, obj but also Gaussian Splats (ply and splat) files can be loaded onto a web experience. Lighting enviroment can easily be applied through the environment attribute.

img.alt: Shader ball demonstrating PBR materials, clear coat, glow, depth of field, and bloom.

content.title: Tuned for Performance
content.desc: It leverages Babylon.js engine WebGPU implementation, and its usage of render bundles, for a faster rendering of complex models. It is as simple as using the engine attribute to specify the default engine (WebGL or WebGPU).

img.alt: Illustration of cardboard box containing smaller packages.

content.title: Compact Package
content.desc: This new Babylon Viewer has a smaller package size (469KB). It uses dynamic imports to defer loading formats (gltf/glb, obj, splat/ply) and capabilities (gtTF extensions for example) depending on the model that is loaded. This reduces the download burden on the end user and reduces the time to get something on the screen.

content.title: Fully Customizable
content.desc: The Babylon Viewer includes a default UI for various capabilities, such as animation. This Default UI can be changed via various CSS variables, part selectors and slots. For unlimited customization, it also exposes the underlying Babylon.js components so that it can fully be adapted to specific scenario and needs.

img.alt: Illustration of laptop computer, desktop computer, smart phone, and tablet.

content.title: Web or Native
content.desc: It can be used in the browser or in native apps. Viewer is a lower level JavaScript class that implements the bulk of the features, and can be used in any babylonjs context (in the browser using pure HTML, in the browser using React, or even in Babylon Native).
